Race.SpecificTitle: Chief of Police -- Town of Pearl River
PW Prop. (Animal Shelter) -- 1 Mill Renewal - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a one (1) mill tax on all the property subject to taxation in the Parish (an estimated $2,021,348 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2019 and ending with the year 2028, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and operating an animal shelter for the Parish, including necessary equipment and facilities therefor?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Protection District No. 11 -- 10 Mills Renewal - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 11 Proposition
(Tax Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Fire Protection District No. 11 of the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a special tax of ten (10) mills on all property subject to taxation in the District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2020 and ending with the year 2029 (an estimated $351,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating works of public improvement for fire protection purposes and, to the extent permitted by law, providing services to injured or ill persons in emergency situations?

Race.SpecificTitle: Drainage District No. 4 -- $96.00 Tax Renewal - BOC - 5 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Drainage District No. 4 Proposition
(Renewal of Maintenance and Operation Tax)
Race.FullText: Shall Drainage District No. 4 of the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to renew the levy of the $96.00 annual maintenance and operation tax for a five year term, commencing 2020 and ending 2024, subject to renewal for five year terms by special election, on each landowner of record within the District for each 10,000 square feet of each lot and parcel owned, to provide funds for the maintenance of the levee system, pumping station, pumps, holding ponds, construction of pumping stations, and acquisition of land therefor, and the operation of the District including costs of the pumping station operation staff, salaries of office staff, utilities and fuels, purchase of equipment necessary for the maintenance or operation of the District, contract services, insurance, and personnel, and other matters related thereto or called for by law, said maintenance and operation tax to generate approximately $116,000.00 annually?
